alert.note: Alert for Northampton (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 9:02AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A LINE OF SHOWERS WILL AFFECT NORTHWESTERN NORTHAMPTON...WESTERN GREENSVILLE...MECKLENBURG...LUNENBURG...WEST CENTRAL SUSSEX... SOUTHEASTERN DINWIDDIE AND BRUNSWICK COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF EMPORIA... At 901 AM EDT, radar indicated showers were located along a line extending from Rehoboth to near Boydton to 6 miles southwest of Clarksville. Movement was east at 30 mph. Winds in excess of 40 mph are possible with these showers. These showers will be near... Boydton and Rehoboth around 905 AM EDT. Lunenburg around 910 AM EDT. Victoria around 915 AM EDT. Kenbridge around 920 AM EDT. South Hill, La Crosse and Dundas around 930 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by these showers include Bacons Fork, Wilburn, Gum Forks, Dolphin, Bowens Corner, Pleasant Shade, Henrico, Finneywood, Forksville and Fairview. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If you are on the lakes, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
